DataElement.preferredName: Central Venous Access Catheter Medical Device Implantation Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information related to medical device attached to a tube surgically placed into a blood vessel for the purpose of giving intravenous fluid and drugs. It also can be used to obtain blood samples._the type of medical device attached to a Central Venous Access Catheter.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Central Venous Access Catheter Medical Device Implantation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to medical device positioned with the tip in the proximal third of the superior vena cava, the right atrium, or the inferior vena cava.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tube surgically placed into a blood vessel for the purpose of giving intravenous fluid and drugs. It also can be used to obtain blood samples. This device avoids the need for separate needle insertions for each infusion or blood test. Examples of these devices include Hickman catheters, which require clamps to make sure the valve is closed, and Groshong catheters, which have a valve that opens as fluid is withdrawn or infused and remains closed when not in use.:Medical device - any machinery designed to aid diagnostic and medical therapies. Medical device has to be designed with rigorous safety standards. There are several basic types of medical devices: life support equipment used to maintain a patient's body functions; therapeutic equipment; monitors and detectors to measure the indexes of a patient's state; imagine machines and laboratory equipment used with diagnostic and status monitoring purposes. In insurance parlance, the term is usually synonymous with assistive device, although it may include medical supplies.

Concepts.definition: A venous catheter positioned with the tip in the proximal third of the superior vena cava, the right atrium, or the inferior vena cava.
Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions.

Property.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure that places something in the human body.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure that places something in the human body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Central Venous Access Catheter Medical Device Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type of medical device attached to a Central Venous Access Catheter.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: a catheter that is inserted through the skin, into a vein in the arm, in the region above the elbow and below the shoulder; this is a peripheral insertion.

A generic term that describes any implantable venous access device that is inserted into a central vein, and connected to a port that can be palpated and accessed for administration of agents and fluid, or for blood sampling.

Concepts.definition: A generic term that describes any implantable venous access device that is inserted into a central vein, and connected to a port that can be palpated and accessed for administration of agents and fluid, or for blood sampling.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: a type of tunneled intravenous catheter used for central venous access, where the tip of the catheter is in the superior vena cava, and the catheter is tunneled under the skin to an incision on the chest wall, where the distal end of the catheter exits the body.

Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.: A surgical procedure that places something in the human body.: An implanted device through which blood may be withdrawn and drugs may be infused without repeated needle sticks.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
A surgical procedure that places something in the human body.
A device designed for the introduction of fluid to or removal of fluid from a system; also an electronic circuit that acts as a connection to an outside device.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: External Tunneled Central Venous Access Catheter

ValueMeaning.preferredName: External Tunneled Central Venous Access Catheter
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.: No Value Exists: A tube surgically placed into a blood vessel for the purpose of giving intravenous fluid and drugs. It also can be used to obtain blood samples. This device avoids the need for separate needle insertions for each infusion or blood test. Examples of these devices include Hickman catheters, which require clamps to make sure the valve is closed, and Groshong catheters, which have a valve that opens as fluid is withdrawn or infused and remains closed when not in use.

Concepts.definition: Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.
A venous catheter positioned with the tip in the proximal third of the superior vena cava, the right atrium, or the inferior vena cava.
